meaningMnemonic:
Because the hiragana ends with an う sound, you know this word is a verb. The kanji itself means <kanji>illuminate</kanji>, so this means <vocabulary>to illuminate</vocabulary> or <vocabulary>to shine light on</vocabulary> something.

But don't get it confused with 照れる, which is "to feel embarrassed" — that would be embarrassing. You know this is "to illuminate" because you get a <reading>rash</reading> (らす) every time something shines on you too much.
readingMnemonic: Speaking of things that illuminate, your <reading>hand</reading>s (手) illuminate all the time for some reason.
